p: The test conditions for NGI experiment were P 1 = 4.00 kPa and Q out = 63.80 L/min. The inhalation time was calculated to be 3.8 s. The laryngeal deposition rate of SCU@CD-MOF was 57.72 ± 2.19%, about twice as high as that of blank CD-MOF ( P < 0.01, Table 2). It can be concluded that the encapsulation of SCU can greatly enhance the laryngeal deposition of CD-MOF particles.
